title: LG announces reopening of 12 tourist destinations in J&K closed after Pahlagam attack

title: Canada sees 50% drop in Indian study permits, $10.5B impact expected
description: Canada has seen a 50% decline in Indian study permit approvals in 2025, with projections suggesting a 67.5% drop from 2023. The number of new student arrivals and total permit holders has also decreased sharply. According to ICEF Monitor, this trend stems from stricter immigration policies, economic pressures, and rising global competition. The downturn could lead to a $10.5 billion shortfall in economic contributions, severely affecting Canadian education institutions and provincial economies.

description: Palestine has formally applied to join the BRICS bloc, confirmed by its ambassador to Russia, Abdel Hafiz Nofal. This move comes as several Western nations, including Canada, Australia, Portugal, and the UK, recently recognized Palestinian statehood. China, a key BRICS member, has expressed openness to welcoming more "like-minded partners" into the expanding group of emerging economies.

title: Delhi: AAP leader dons mosquito net to sting BJP on dengue cases - watch

description: A new COVID-19 variant, Stratus, is now spreading globally. This variant, first detected in Southeast Asia, is currently predominant in several US states. Stratus evades the immune system better than the previous Nimbus strain. It causes typical COVID-19 symptoms, though often mild for vaccinated individuals. Health experts advise precautions like masking and hand washing to prevent its spread. Read below!

Sharif nominated Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, calling him "a man of peace" for his contributions, despite India's denial of any foreign influence in their operations.

Why Trump is unlikely to win the Nobel Peace Prize
description: Trump is obsessed with the Peace Prize.  He mentions it at rallies, he hounds his allies, he discusses it with enemies, he literally demands world leaders nominate him for it and even threatens Norway with tariffs if Oslo doesn’t give him one. Take this year’s UN General Assembly, where Trump, while complaining about escalators and teleprompters, claimed he had “stopped seven wars” — Israel–Iran, India–Pakistan, Armenia–Azerbaijan, Congo–Rwanda, Serbia–Kosovo, Egypt–Ethiopia, and even Thailand–Cambodia.

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the UN, displaying a QR code of Hamas atrocities and directly speaking to hostages. He demanded Hamas release captives and accept Israel's terms for Gaza's future, asserting Israel "must finish the job" against Hamas despite global pressure, as delegates walked out during his speech.

title: Algo diplomacy: How Xi used TikTok to court Trump - robbery or 'win-win'?
description: President Trump endorsed a $14 billion deal to spin off TikTok's US operations, fulfilling a 2024 divestment law. This strategic move by China aims to reset US-China ties, potentially trading TikTok for tariff relief and diplomatic breathing room. Trump hails it as a political victory, while the deal reshapes tech diplomacy and global power dynamics.

title: Kendrick Perkins's grandmother passes away at 90
description: NBA analyst Kendrick Perkins is deeply saddened by the passing of his 90-year-old grandmother, Mary Lewis, who raised him after his mother's early death. She was his unwavering support through his entire life and career. Perkins, who lost his grandfather at 29, shared an emotional tribute on Instagram, highlighting her profound impact and unconditional love.

Donald Trump throws kitchen sink at big pharma with targeted tariffs
description: Donald Trump imposed a 100% tariff on patented drugs unless manufactured in the US, effective October 2025. India's generic pharma exports remain largely unaffected, and major Indian branded drug exporters already have US plants. However, India's $66 billion pharmaceutical industry is closely monitoring potential future tariffs on generics.

title: 'Don’t think they’ll even manage that': Bachchan trolls Pakistan, Akhtar
description: Abhishek Bachchan humorously reacted after Shoaib Akhtar mistakenly referred to cricketer Abhishek Sharma as the actor during a live show discussing the India-Pakistan Asia Cup final. Akhtar's on-air blooper left panellists in splits, prompting Bachchan's witty reply on X, stating even he couldn't get out. This viral moment blended cricket and Bollywood ahead of the highly anticipated final.

title: UK toddler murder: Indian-origin duo charged with killing 3-year-old
description: Metropolitan Police have charged Indian-origin individuals, Manpreet Jatana (34) and Jaskiret Singh Uppal (36), with the murder of 3-year-old Penelope Chandrie. The toddler was found deceased at a Hayes residence on December 17, 2023. Following a nearly two-year investigation, the pair were arrested and charged this week, appearing in Uxbridge Magistrates' Court. The case now proceeds through criminal court.

description: India made two changes for their final Super Fours fixture against Sri Lanka, resting pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah and all-rounder Shivam Dube, with Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana drafted in. This match holds no significance in terms of qualification for India, who have already secured their spot in the Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Skipper Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the need for fielding improvements.

She balances style, social influence, and philanthropy, establishing herself as a prominent figure in Edmonton.

title: Report: Taylor Swift overwhelmed planning Kelce wedding amid security
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, engaged after dating since 2023, are actively planning their wedding. Swift is enjoying researching venues and considering numerous offers from major designers to create her wedding gown, feeling overwhelmed by the response. Concerns arise regarding Swift's security, highlighted by her increased safety measures and absences from recent Chiefs' games.

title: 'They didn’t want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on being rejected from movie
description: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Silicon Valley Billionaire warns: H-1B policy may backfire; Indian engineers at risk
description: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.
